Claim: This video shows panic buying in the United States, during the coronavirus outbreak
Explaination: But the video has been shared in a misleading context; it has circulated online since November 2019, weeks before the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan.
Label: False
html:
Claim: This video shows panic buying in the United States, during the coronavirus outbreak

Explanation:But the video has been shared in a misleading context; it has circulated online since November 2019, weeks before the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-has-circulated-online-november-2019-weeks-covid-19-outbreak

Claim: A video caption said: “Doctor affected by the virus in a hospital in Wuhan, China.”
Explaination: Prior instances of the video had captions, confirmed by media reports, said the video showed a doctor collapsing in Yunnan province because of overwork and hypoglycemia.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video caption said: “Doctor affected by the virus in a hospital in Wuhan, China.”

Explanation:Prior instances of the video had captions, confirmed by media reports, said the video showed a doctor collapsing in Yunnan province because of overwork and hypoglycemia.

Claim: A photo of a man and woman embracing has been shared on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim that it shows two Italian doctors who died from COVID-19 after contracting the disease from the patients they treated.
Explaination: The claim is false; this is an Associated Press photo of a couple kissing at an airport in Barcelona, Spain.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photo of a man and woman embracing has been shared on Facebook and Twitter alongside a claim that it shows two Italian doctors who died from COVID-19 after contracting the disease from the patients they treated.

Explanation:The claim is false; this is an Associated Press photo of a couple kissing at an airport in Barcelona, Spain.

Claim: A photo of a room lined with coffins shows Italian nationals killed during the novel coronavirus pandemic in 2020.
Explaination: The claim is false; the photo actually shows coffins for a group of dead migrants at an Italian airport in October 2013 after their boat sank off the coast of Italy.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photo of a room lined with coffins shows Italian nationals killed during the novel coronavirus pandemic in 2020.

Explanation:The claim is false; the photo actually shows coffins for a group of dead migrants at an Italian airport in October 2013 after their boat sank off the coast of Italy.

https://factcheck.afp.com/photo-shows-coffins-dead-migrants-after-boat-capsized-coast-italy-2013

Explaination: These were mock drills that were conducted by the UP Police to determine the preparedness of the public with regards to COVID-19.

Claim: Walmart has adopted staggered shopping days based on age in response to the pandemic.
Explaination: Walmart has not restricted shopping days by age, except for weekly hour for senior citizens.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Walmart has adopted staggered shopping days based on age in response to the pandemic.

Explanation:Walmart has not restricted shopping days by age, except for weekly hour for senior citizens.

Claim: The coronavirus has been discovered in poultry.

Label: False
html:

Claim: An image shared on social media claims this Italian doctor couple worked day and night and saved the lives of 134 patients, but on the eighth day, they contracted the coronavirus and died after an hour.
Explaination: The couple in the picture is not Italian but a couple from Spain. The photograph was taken at Barcelona Airport on March 12, 2020.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An image shared on social media claims this Italian doctor couple worked day and night and saved the lives of 134 patients, but on the eighth day, they contracted the coronavirus and died after an hour.

Explanation:The couple in the picture is not Italian but a couple from Spain. The photograph was taken at Barcelona Airport on March 12, 2020.

Claim: For coronavirus cases “in the U.S. 38% of those hospitalized are under 35.”
Explaination: The CDC reported that between mid-February and mid-March, 20% of the hospitalizations for coronavirus were for patients age 20-44 and 18% were age 45-54.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: For coronavirus cases “in the U.S. 38% of those hospitalized are under 35.”

Explanation:The CDC reported that between mid-February and mid-March, 20% of the hospitalizations for coronavirus were for patients age 20-44 and 18% were age 45-54.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/20/marco-rubio/young-people-are-being-hospitalized-covid-19-too-l/

Claim: A positive case of the 2019 novel coronavirus was “confirmed” to be found in Cebu province.
Explaination: The Department of Health announced on Jan. 28 there remains to be no positive case of the 2019 nCoV in the country, only that there are 27 people under investigation for suspected infection.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A positive case of the 2019 novel coronavirus was “confirmed” to be found in Cebu province.

Explanation:The Department of Health announced on Jan. 28 there remains to be no positive case of the 2019 nCoV in the country, only that there are 27 people under investigation for suspected infection.

https://verafiles.org/articles/vera-files-fact-check-fb-posts-mislead-claims-positive-novel

Claim: Dead bodies of coronavirus patients are being discarded in mass graves in Italy, according to a 23-second video clip that has gone viral on social media.
Explaination: The video clip was from the US miniseries Pandemic released in 2007.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Dead bodies of coronavirus patients are being discarded in mass graves in Italy, according to a 23-second video clip that has gone viral on social media.

Explanation:The video clip was from the US miniseries Pandemic released in 2007.

Claim: 10,000 deaths In virus outbreak in Michigan, Washington, Idaho, North Dakota, Missouri, Mississippi.
Explaination: The CDC counted 25 deaths and 647 confirmed coronavirus cases in the United States as of March 10, 2020.
Label: False
html:
Claim: 10,000 deaths In virus outbreak in Michigan, Washington, Idaho, North Dakota, Missouri, Mississippi.

Explanation:The CDC counted 25 deaths and 647 confirmed coronavirus cases in the United States as of March 10, 2020.

Claim: A viral video apparently showing Muslim devotees sneezing is circulated with the claim that it is from Nizamuddin mosque of Delhi and they are deliberately trying to get infected in order to spread coronavirus in India.
Explaination: The video shows an age-old Sufi ritual called Dhikr (Zikr). It is a kind of prayer/meditation in which followers of Sufism remember their god while breathing heavily. The video is available on the internet for the past few months. It has nothing to do with Nizamuddin Mosque or coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A viral video apparently showing Muslim devotees sneezing is circulated with the claim that it is from Nizamuddin mosque of Delhi and they are deliberately trying to get infected in order to spread coronavirus in India.

Explanation:The video shows an age-old Sufi ritual called Dhikr (Zikr). It is a kind of prayer/meditation in which followers of Sufism remember their god while breathing heavily. The video is available on the internet for the past few months. It has nothing to do with Nizamuddin Mosque or coronavirus.

https://marathi.factcrescendo.com/video-of-sufi-ritual-shared-with-false-claim-as-deliberate-attempt-of-spreading-coronavirus/

Claim: LGBTQ people in the US are demanding to be treated first for coronavirus.
Explaination: Pulpit and Pen quotes a Reuters article about an open letter signed by more than 100 LGBTQ rights groups, calling on organisations handling the global coronavirus pandemic to remember “that LGBTQ+ communities are among those who are particularly vulnerable to the negative health effects of this virus”. But it doesn't ask for anyone to be given priority treatment.
Label: False
html:
Claim: LGBTQ people in the US are demanding to be treated first for coronavirus.

Explanation:Pulpit and Pen quotes a Reuters article about an open letter signed by more than 100 LGBTQ rights groups, calling on organisations handling the global coronavirus pandemic to remember “that LGBTQ+ communities are among those who are particularly vulnerable to the negative health effects of this virus”. But it doesn't ask for anyone to be given priority treatment.

https://africacheck.org/fbcheck/no-lgbtq-people-in-us-havent-demanded-first-treatment-for-covid-19/

Claim: Audio claiming India would be put under a complete lockdown.
Explaination: The government rubbished claims of there being such a lockdown.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Audio claiming India would be put under a complete lockdown.

Explanation:The government rubbished claims of there being such a lockdown.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/pib-rubbishes-viral-whatsapp-audio-clip-claiming-india-will-go-into-a-lockdown-7230

Claim: Costco recalls toilet paper because it’s infected with the coronavirus.
Explaination: The notice is not authentic, according to a statement from the wholesaler, and the brand of bath tissue in question is not listed on official recall websites.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Costco recalls toilet paper because it’s infected with the coronavirus.

Explanation:The notice is not authentic, according to a statement from the wholesaler, and the brand of bath tissue in question is not listed on official recall websites.

https://factcheck.afp.com/costco-not-recalling-bath-tissue-due-novel-coronavirus-contamination?fbclid=IwAR1TBUpUk_Y_6RW_VqxxUBmU-bhJ7iNrUSmYHmoTnH0Fb9_-hKJiNzaLrfY

Claim: NY banned cigarette sales because of the coronavirus.
Explaination: Gov. Andrew Cuomo's team told Lead Stories that he is not about to announce a six-week ban on cigarette sales to help curb the death rate from COVID-19, which has devastated the state.
Label: False
html:
Claim: NY banned cigarette sales because of the coronavirus.

Explanation:Gov. Andrew Cuomo's team told Lead Stories that he is not about to announce a six-week ban on cigarette sales to help curb the death rate from COVID-19, which has devastated the state.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/fact-check-15.html

Claim: A man in Italy killed himself after he lost his family to the coronavirus.
Explaination: The video is being shared with a completely false claim. Firstly, the video is as old as 2015, which is long before the outbreak of the novel coronavirus. Secondly, the video is not from Italy but Philadelphia in the United States of America.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A man in Italy killed himself after he lost his family to the coronavirus.

Explanation:The video is being shared with a completely false claim. Firstly, the video is as old as 2015, which is long before the outbreak of the novel coronavirus. Secondly, the video is not from Italy but Philadelphia in the United States of America.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/man-killed-self-after-losing-kin-to-covid-19-in-italy-fact-check

Claim: A claim that police in Thailand can issue fines to anyone who does not wear a face mask in public during the novel coronavirus pandemic has been shared repeatedly on Facebook, Twitter and Line Messenger.
Explaination: The claim is false; Thai legal experts told AFP there is no law in the country that allows police to fine people for not wearing face masks; Thai police issued several statements calling the claims “fake news”.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A claim that police in Thailand can issue fines to anyone who does not wear a face mask in public during the novel coronavirus pandemic has been shared repeatedly on Facebook, Twitter and Line Messenger.

Explanation:The claim is false; Thai legal experts told AFP there is no law in the country that allows police to fine people for not wearing face masks; Thai police issued several statements calling the claims “fake news”.

https://factcheck.afp.com/covid-pandemic-misinformation-spreads-thailand-about-police-powers-fine-people-who-fail-wear-face

Claim: Pigs are being burned alive in China to control the coronavirus.
Explaination: Viral video is around a year old and has nothing to do with coronavirus in China.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Pigs are being burned alive in China to control the coronavirus.

Explanation:Viral video is around a year old and has nothing to do with coronavirus in China.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-is-the-chinese-govt-burning-pigs-alive-to-contain-coronavirus-1642960-2020-02-03

Claim: A video shows people screaming in Wuhan because they feared the coronavirus.
Explaination: The video is actually of Wuhan residents whistling and shouting to commemorate Dr. Li Wenliang, the whistleblower of the virus who died on February 7 after getting infected.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A video shows people screaming in Wuhan because they feared the coronavirus.

Explanation:The video is actually of Wuhan residents whistling and shouting to commemorate Dr. Li Wenliang, the whistleblower of the virus who died on February 7 after getting infected.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/video-of-wuhan-residents-mourning-doctors-death-shared-with-false-claims-6834

Claim: Video shows a woman eating a bat soup in Wuhan.
Explaination: We tracked the girl's social media accounts, confirmed they were authentic. She claims the video was taken over the summer but wouldn't tell were. The setup and meal look like Palau traditional bat soup but we couldn't confirm.
Label: No evidence
html:
Claim: Video shows a woman eating a bat soup in Wuhan.

Explanation:We tracked the girl's social media accounts, confirmed they were authentic. She claims the video was taken over the summer but wouldn't tell were. The setup and meal look like Palau traditional bat soup but we couldn't confirm.

https://observers.france24.com/fr/20200130-intox-chine-soupe-chauve-souris-rumeur-origine-coronavirus?check=1

Claim: “Wisconsin is the only state where all Republicans voted against protecting its citizens.”
Explaination: Wisconsin is indeed the only one of the 50 states where all Republicans voted no. But it’s a bit of an exaggeration to describe that vote as “against protecting its citizens.”
Label: MOSTLY TRUE
html:
Claim: “Wisconsin is the only state where all Republicans voted against protecting its citizens.”

Explanation:Wisconsin is indeed the only one of the 50 states where all Republicans voted no. But it’s a bit of an exaggeration to describe that vote as “against protecting its citizens.”

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/20/facebook-posts/yes-wisconsin-only-state-where-all-republicans-opp/

Claim: Video shows a parasite being removed for someone’s lips, sharing it in relation with coronavirus.
Explaination: The video was uploaded on YouTube on October 24, 2019 with the title “Amazing Botfly Removal on Lips”.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Video shows a parasite being removed for someone’s lips, sharing it in relation with coronavirus.

Explanation:The video was uploaded on YouTube on October 24, 2019 with the title “Amazing Botfly Removal on Lips”.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_14649851

Claim: Video of “the market of terror, where the coronavirus originated”.
Explaination: The video was transmitted by most of the Macedonian media, although it is false. The truth is that this video is not of a market in Wuhan, nor anywhere in China, but it is of a market in Indonesia. When you play the video you can see the name of the market in large letters, i.e. Pasar Estream Langowan, and when you search, if you do not know where Langowan is, you will find out that it is in Indonesia, not in China. The falseness of this video was also noted by the AFP FactCheck and Faktly.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Video of “the market of terror, where the coronavirus originated”.

Explanation:The video was transmitted by most of the Macedonian media, although it is false. The truth is that this video is not of a market in Wuhan, nor anywhere in China, but it is of a market in Indonesia. When you play the video you can see the name of the market in large letters, i.e. Pasar Estream Langowan, and when you search, if you do not know where Langowan is, you will find out that it is in Indonesia, not in China. The falseness of this video was also noted by the AFP FactCheck and Faktly.

https://truthmeter.mk/the-market-of-terror-is-in-indonesia-not-in-wuhan/

Claim: Indian Ministry of Tourism issued a notification that all hotels, restaurants, pubs etc will be closed till 10/1520. The notification further states that specifically north Indian restaurants should be closed till the given date else legal action will be taken against the owner of the restaurant.
Explaination: Ministry of Tourism has not issued any such order which states that all restaurants in India will be closed till 15th October 2020 in order to curb the spread of COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Indian Ministry of Tourism issued a notification that all hotels, restaurants, pubs etc will be closed till 10/1520. The notification further states that specifically north Indian restaurants should be closed till the given date else legal action will be taken against the owner of the restaurant.

Explanation:Ministry of Tourism has not issued any such order which states that all restaurants in India will be closed till 15th October 2020 in order to curb the spread of COVID-19.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/04/10/the-ministry-of-tourism-has-not-issued-any-order-closing-down-restaurants-till-october/
